metadata.subject: Alex Acosta resigns, Jeffrey Epstein arrested and Trump ends bid for citizenship question on census

relationships.description: Acosta resigned as Labor Secretary amid scrutiny of his handling of Epstein's case
Epstein had flown Trump on his private jet and rubbed elbows with elites
UK ambassador resigned after criticizing Trump in leaked memos

analysis.purpose: To provide a weekly news summary covering major political and current events
analysis.significance: Shows media coverage of Epstein case and political developments during July 2019

notable_quotes: Labor Secretary Alex Acosta's resignation Friday amid the mushrooming Jeffrey Epstein investigation made him the latest in a growing list of President Trump's Cabinet officials to leave under a cloud
He has rubbed elbows with a prince and flown a former president on his private jet. He amassed a fortune that includes a 100-acre island

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found in this news summary email

illegal_activity.description: This is a news summary email containing articles about Epstein's case and other political events, not first-hand illegal activity

details: Multiple news organizations referenced: Washington Post, AP, Guardian, CNN, Reuters, NBC, NY Times, CNBC, Politico, NPR

public_knowledge.context: This email contains publicly reported news stories about high-profile political events and the Jeffrey Epstein case that received significant media coverage in July 2019

analysis.summary: This Flipboard email newsletter summarizes major news stories from July 2019, including Alex Acosta's resignation over his handling of the Jeffrey Epstein case, Epstein's arrest, UK ambassador Kim Darroch's resignation, Trump's census decision, and other political developments.
